meanings.definition: A branch of knowledge or learning
meanings.sent1: Studying different disciplines helps us learn new things.
meanings.sent2: In school, students study various disciplines like math and history.
meanings.sent3: The library had a sense of humor and decided to mix up all the disciplines in one section.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a garden where disciplines bloomed into beautiful flowers of wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made the disciplines come alive with exciting stories and examples.

meanings.definition: Training to act in accordance with rules
meanings.sent1: Military training instills discipline in soldiers to follow orders.
meanings.sent2: Athletes need discipline to practice regularly and improve their skills.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to learn discipline but kept chasing its tail instead.
meanings.sent4: Discipline was the compass guiding him through the stormy seas of life.
meanings.sent5: The strict coach enforced discipline on the team to achieve success.

meanings.definition: Punishment inflicted by way of correction and training
meanings.sent1: As a child, he faced discipline for misbehaving in class.
meanings.sent2: Parents use discipline to teach their children right from wrong.
meanings.sent3: The naughty cat received discipline in the form of a time-out in the laundry room.
meanings.sent4: Life's discipline molded him into a person of character and integrity.
meanings.sent5: The discipline of consequences taught her valuable lessons about responsibility.
